name: B. Keyboard Layouts
statement:
There are two popular keyboard layouts in Berland, they differ only in
letters positions. All the other keys are the same. In Berland they use
alphabet with letters which coincides with English alphabet.You are
given two strings consisting of distinct letters each: all keys of the
first and the second layouts in the same order. You are also given some
text consisting of small and capital English letters and digits. It is
known that it was typed in the first layout, but the writer intended to
type it in the second layout. Print the text if the same keys were
pressed in the second layout.Since all keys but letters are the same in
both layouts, the capitalization of the letters should remain the same,
as well as all other characters.
